name: Mafia Headquarters
description: A concealed Mafia headquarters hidden beneath Cassandra's train station platform, accessed through a disguised dock. This location serves as the operational center for the local Mafia and the base of power for its leader, Ben Cleo.

snapshot.name: Hidden Dock and Mafia Base
snapshot.location: Beneath the Cassandra Train Station Platform
snapshot.description: Behind the false façade of a quiet train platform lies a secret dock area leading into the Mafia headquarters. The space is utilitarian and guarded, designed for clandestine meetings and illegal operations. Investigators who reach this location are immediately at risk of confrontation but may also gain crucial leverage through negotiation.

characters.name: Ben Cleo
characters.notes: The leader of the local Mafia. Calm, pragmatic, and confident. He insists he is not responsible for EITHER murder case: not the FIRST CASE (19-year-old girl, frozen in ice, December 22, 2002) nor the SECOND CASE (21-year-old Lucifero, killed at Reindeer Bar, December 22, 2003). He is willing to negotiate with investigators under strict conditions.

clues.clueText: The headquarters is directly connected to the train station platform via a hidden dock.
reveals: The true purpose of the train station platform
The Mafia’s method of covert movement

clues.clueText: Ben Cleo claims that the real power behind Cassandra is a man named Padriche, and that Padriche's actions threaten Mafia interests. Ben mentions Padriche may be connected to BOTH murder cases—the first case from 2002 and the recent case from 2003.
reveals: Padriche as a major hidden antagonist
Possible connection between Padriche and both murder cases
The first case (2002) and second case (2003) may both be part of Padriche's larger plan

clues.clueText: Ben Cleo confirms he knows about BOTH murder cases: the FIRST CASE (December 22, 2002, 19-year-old girl frozen in ice at Paradil Grand Hotel) and the SECOND CASE (December 22, 2003, 21-year-old Lucifero killed at Reindeer Bar). He denies involvement in either.
reveals: Ben is aware of both cases despite the first being officially suppressed
The Mafia has information networks that extend beyond official records
Two separate cases, exactly one year apart, with different methods

conditions.description: Dim artificial lighting, creating heavy shadows throughout the headquarters.
Echoing water sounds from the dock mixed with low, tense voices.

events: Investigators are confronted by Mafia members upon arrival.
Negotiation between Ben Cleo and the investigators regarding secrecy and mutual interests.

exits.description: A concealed route back to the platform above.

snapshot.keeperNotes: This scene should emphasize tension rather than immediate violence. Ben Cleo is dangerous but rational; he prefers negotiation if it protects his interests. CRITICALLY: Ben knows about BOTH MURDER CASES. The FIRST CASE (December 22, 2002) involved a 19-year-old Black girl found frozen in ice at Paradil Grand Hotel. The SECOND CASE (December 22, 2003) involved 21-year-old Aberforth Locefern (Lucifero) killed by gunshot and knife at Reindeer Bar. Ben denies involvement in either case but has information about both. If investigators betray his trust or reveal the secret of the platform, the Mafia will become a persistent hostile force.
permanentChanges: If investigators strike a deal with Ben Cleo, the Mafia may become a temporary ally.
If negotiations fail, the Mafia becomes openly hostile toward the investigators.

connections.description: The Mafia headquarters can only be accessed through the hidden dock beneath the train station platform.
Information obtained here directs investigators toward Padriche as a key figure behind the events in Cassandra.
